hints.Structure and Properties of Matter: This concept focuses on understanding the properties of substances and how the atomic and molecular structure of a substance determines its properties.
hints.Chemical Reactions: Students learn about the processes that lead to the rearrangement of atoms in substances, including the principles of conservation of matter and energy.
hints.Forces and Interactions: This concept explores how forces at a distance are explained by fields that can transfer energy and can be described mathematically.
hints.Energy: Students learn about the conservation of energy and energy transfer, as well as the relationship between energy and forces.
hints.Waves and Electromagnetic Radiation: This includes understanding the characteristics of waves and how waves can be used to transfer information.
hints.Interdependent Relationships in Ecosyste: This concept focuses on how organisms interact with their physical environment and with other organisms in their ecological community.
hints.Cycles of Matter and Energy Transfer in: Students learn about the cycling of matter and flow of energy within and among organisms and ecosystems.
hints.Heredity: This concept covers the process of inheritance and how genetic traits vary among individuals and populations.
hints.Biological Evolution: This explores the mechanisms of evolution and the resulting diversity of life on Earth.
hints.Earth's Systems: Students learn about the dynamic nature of Earth's systems and how they interact over various scales of time and space.
hints.Earth and Human Activity: This concept explores how human activities affect Earthâ€™s systems and how these effects can be mitigated.
hints.Engineering Design: This concept covers the process of defining a problem and developing, testing, and optimizing solutions.
hints.Links Among Engineering, Technology, Sci: This involves understanding how science, engineering, and technology influence and are influenced by society.
hints.Energy in Chemical Processes and Everyda: This covers the principles behind energy transfer and conservation in chemical reactions and processes.
hints.Role of Water in Earth\u00e2\u20ac\u2122: This concept explores the crucial role water plays in shaping Earth's surface processes and supporting life.
